trans-unit.source: Resolve GPO and Intune policy conflicts | Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: Resolve GPO and Intune policy conflicts | Microsoft Intune

trans-unit.source: Learn how to resolve conflicts between Group Policy and Intune configuration policies.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to resolve conflicts between Group Policy and Intune configuration policies.

trans-unit.source: Resolve Group Policy Objects (GPO) and Microsoft Intune policy conflicts
trans-unit.target: Resolve Group Policy Objects (GPO) and Microsoft Intune policy conflicts

trans-unit.source: Intune uses policies that help you manage settings on Windows PCs.
trans-unit.target: Intune uses policies that help you manage settings on Windows PCs.

trans-unit.source: For example, you can use a policy to control settings for the Windows Firewall on PCs.
trans-unit.target: For example, you can use a policy to control settings for the Windows Firewall on PCs.

trans-unit.source: Many Intune settings are similar to settings that you might configure with Windows Group Policy.
trans-unit.target: Many Intune settings are similar to settings that you might configure with Windows Group Policy.

trans-unit.source: However, it is possible that, at times, the two methods might conflict with each another.
trans-unit.target: However, it is possible that, at times, the two methods might conflict with each another.

trans-unit.source: When conflicts happen, domain-level Group Policy takes precedence over Intune policy, unless the PC can’t sign in to the domain.
trans-unit.target: When conflicts happen, domain-level Group Policy takes precedence over Intune policy, unless the PC can’t sign in to the domain.

trans-unit.source: In this case, Intune policy is applied to the client PC.
trans-unit.target: In this case, Intune policy is applied to the client PC.

trans-unit.source: What to do if you are using Group Policy
trans-unit.target: What to do if you are using Group Policy

trans-unit.source: Make sure that policies that you apply are not being managed by Group Policy.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that policies that you apply are not being managed by Group Policy.

trans-unit.source: To help prevent conflicts, you can use one or more of the following methods:
trans-unit.target: To help prevent conflicts, you can use one or more of the following methods:

trans-unit.source: Move your PCs to an Active Directory organizational unit (OU) that does not have Group Policy settings applied before you install the Intune client.
trans-unit.target: Move your PCs to an Active Directory organizational unit (OU) that does not have Group Policy settings applied before you install the Intune client.

trans-unit.source: You can also block Group Policy inheritance on OUs that contain PCs enrolled in Intune to which you do not want to apply Group Policy settings.
trans-unit.target: You can also block Group Policy inheritance on OUs that contain PCs enrolled in Intune to which you do not want to apply Group Policy settings.

trans-unit.source: Use a security group filter to restrict GPOs only to PCs that are not managed by Intune.
trans-unit.target: Use a security group filter to restrict GPOs only to PCs that are not managed by Intune.

trans-unit.source: Disable or remove the Group Policy Objects that conflict with the Intune policies.
trans-unit.target: Disable or remove the Group Policy Objects that conflict with the Intune policies.

trans-unit.source: For more information about Active Directory and Windows Group Policy, see your Windows Server Documentation.
trans-unit.target: For more information about Active Directory and Windows Group Policy, see your Windows Server Documentation.

trans-unit.source: How to filter existing GPOs to avoid conflicts with Intune policy
trans-unit.target: How to filter existing GPOs to avoid conflicts with Intune policy

trans-unit.source: If you have identified GPOs whose settings conflict with Intune policies, you can use security group filters to restrict those GPOs only to PCs that are not managed by Intune.
trans-unit.target: If you have identified GPOs whose settings conflict with Intune policies, you can use security group filters to restrict those GPOs only to PCs that are not managed by Intune.

trans-unit.source: You can apply GPOs to only those security groups that are specified in the **Security Filtering** area of the Group Policy Management console for a selected GPO.
trans-unit.target: You can apply GPOs to only those security groups that are specified in the **Security Filtering** area of the Group Policy Management console for a selected GPO.

trans-unit.source: By default, GPOs apply to *Authenticated Users*.
trans-unit.target: By default, GPOs apply to *Authenticated Users*.

trans-unit.source: In the **Active Directory Users and Computers** snap-in, create a new security group that contains computers and user accounts that you do not want Intune to manage.
trans-unit.target: In the **Active Directory Users and Computers** snap-in, create a new security group that contains computers and user accounts that you do not want Intune to manage.

trans-unit.source: For example, you might name the group *Not In Microsoft Intune*.
trans-unit.target: For example, you might name the group *Not In Microsoft Intune*.

trans-unit.source: In the Group Policy Management console, on the **Delegation** tab for the selected GPO, right-click the new security group to delegate appropriate **Read** and **Apply Group Policy** permissions to both users and computers in the security group.
trans-unit.target: In the Group Policy Management console, on the **Delegation** tab for the selected GPO, right-click the new security group to delegate appropriate **Read** and **Apply Group Policy** permissions to both users and computers in the security group.

trans-unit.source: (**Apply Group Policy** permissions are available on the **Advanced** dialog box.)
trans-unit.target: (**Apply Group Policy** permissions are available on the **Advanced** dialog box.)

trans-unit.source: Then, apply the new security group filter to a selected GPO, and remove the **Authenticated Users** default filter.
trans-unit.target: Then, apply the new security group filter to a selected GPO, and remove the **Authenticated Users** default filter.

trans-unit.source: The new security group must be maintained as enrollment in the Intune service changes.
trans-unit.target: The new security group must be maintained as enrollment in the Intune service changes.

trans-unit.source: See also
trans-unit.target: See also

trans-unit.source: Manage Windows PCs with Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: Manage Windows PCs with Microsoft Intune
